question: Which rock is produced by deposition and cementation?

content.source_1: In geology, deposition and cementation are key steps of lithification that convert loose sediments into sedimentary rock.
content.source_2: Sedimentary rocks form when sediments are deposited in layers and, through compaction and cementation, become solid rock.
content.source_3: Cementation is the precipitation of minerals from pore fluids that bind sediment grains together, a hallmark of sedimentary rock formation.
content.source_4: Tuff is an igneous (pyroclastic) rock composed chiefly of consolidated volcanic ash from explosive eruptions.
content.source_5: Volcanic ash is deposited from eruption plumes or pyroclastic flows and can later become compacted and cemented to form tuff.
content.source_6: Pyroclastic deposits may lithify by welding or by cementation; because their material is volcanic in origin, the resulting rocks are classified as igneous.
